speaker: Clinician
text: So, with the increase to 88 mcg of levothyroxine, have you noticed any changes in how you're feeling? Any, uh, new symptoms or anything like that?

speaker: Patient
text: Not really, I mean, I feel pretty much the same. Maybe a bit more energetic, but it's hard to tell if that's just because I've been more active lately.

speaker: Clinician
text: That's good to hear. Sometimes it can take a little while for the body to adjust. Just keep an eye out for any unusual symptoms, like palpitations or, um, increased sweating.

speaker: Patient
text: Okay, I'll watch for those. I usually take it first thing in the morning, like you suggested. Is that still the best time?

speaker: Clinician
text: Yes, taking it on an empty stomach in the morning is ideal. It helps with absorption. And, uh, just to confirm, you're still spacing it out from your atorvastatin, right?

speaker: Patient
text: Yes, I take the atorvastatin at night. I remember you mentioned that before, so I've been sticking to it.
